The claim being verified is that Sen: Rubio has the worst vote attendance record of any Florida senator in nearly 50 years.
The expert turned to GovTrack: which keeps a record of votes by members of Congress, to check the claim.
The expert found that Rubio: s overall absentee rate during his first term was 14.5 percent, considerably higher than the 1.7 percent average absentee rate among all senators in the same time period.
The expert compared Rubio: s absentee rate to previous Florida senators and found that the last senator from Florida to exceed Rubio's rate was George Smathers, a Democrat who had a 23.6 percent absentee rate over his 18 years in office.
